meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes damage.
meanings.sent1: The reckless driver was a damagers on the road.
meanings.sent2: The vandals were known as notorious damagers in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel turned into a little damagers, knocking over flower pots.
meanings.sent4: The storm was a relentless damagers, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The termite infestation acted as silent but effective damagers to the wooden structure.

meanings.definition: Plural form of 'damager', referring to multiple individuals or things that cause damage.
meanings.sent1: The team of workers were diligent damagers, repairing the broken fence.
meanings.sent2: The gang of thieves were notorious damagers in the city.
meanings.sent3: The group of mischievous kids turned into little damagers, playing pranks on their neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The swarm of locusts were a natural damagers to the crops.
meanings.sent5: The pack of wolves acted as efficient damagers to the livestock in the area.
